commits.subject: feat: enhance comparison view with summary and winner indicators
commits.body:
Add "Quick Summary" section at top of comparison view:
- Shows best-for insights per option (e.g., "Best for net profit and lower TP risk")
- Grid layout adapts to number of options being compared
- Only displays when there are clear winners to report

Add winner indicators in comparison table:
- ★ star icon marks best value for each metric
- Green text and background highlighting for winning values
- Smart detection avoids marking ties as winners

Completes Priority 3 of Negotiation Mode implementation:
- Summary row in comparison view
- Winner indicators per metric
commits.title: enhance comparison view with summary and winner indicators

commits.subject: feat: implement Negotiation Mode UI changes
commits.body:
Based on Discovery Framework findings, implement "Simplified by Default" approach
for client-facing negotiation sessions.

Input Field Enhancements:
- Add benchmark property for industry standard badges (e.g., "Industry: 5-15%")
- Add essential property to control field grouping
- InputField displays benchmark badges next to labels

Calculator Page Refactor:
- Progressive disclosure: Essential inputs visible, Advanced collapsed
- Sensitivity/Projections moved to collapsible "Advanced Analysis" section
- Transfer Pricing collapsed by default (shows risk badge)
- One-click save with auto-generated names
- Saved options count shown in action bar

This aligns with the 5 design principles from discovery:
1. Client in the room - cleaner, less overwhelming UI
2. Neutral ground first - industry benchmarks prominently displayed
3. Show both sides - Developer/Buyer results always visible
4. Progressive complexity - advanced features tucked away
5. Compare to decide - prominent save, easy comparison flow
commits.title: implement Negotiation Mode UI changes

commits.subject: docs: add Negotiation Mode design and UI audit
commits.body:
Created NEGOTIATION_MODE.md with:
- 5-minute client walkthrough script
- Screen-by-screen requirements for negotiation use case
- Feature visibility matrix (show/hide by mode)
- Implementation recommendation: "Simplified by Default"

Completed UI audit against 5 design principles:
- Client in the room: Partial - tabs may confuse
- Neutral ground first: Fix needed - no benchmark badges
- Show both sides: Good - Developer/Buyer panels work
- Progressive complexity: Fix needed - all inputs visible
- Compare to decide: Partial - save requires modal

Created prioritised fix list:
- Priority 1: Industry badges, collapse advanced features, one-click save
- Priority 2: Group inputs into Essential/Advanced
- Priority 3: Comparison view enhancements
commits.title: add Negotiation Mode design and UI audit

commits.subject: docs: complete discovery session and document findings
commits.body:
Applied Discovery Framework to understand actual tool usage:
- Key finding: tool used WITH clients in live negotiations, not as back-office calculator
- Actual users: tech-sales + non-technical exec + finance exec
- Tool enters after discovery, during "let's structure this together"

Created DISCOVERY_FINDINGS.md with:
- Full session documentation (People, Flow, Data, Why Now)
- Gap analysis comparing findings vs current solution
- 5 design principles derived from discovery
- Plan: define negotiation mode → audit UI → create fix list

Updated TODO.md with high-priority alignment tasks
Updated SESSION_NOTES.md with current state and next steps
commits.title: complete discovery session and document findings

commits.subject: docs: add Discovery Framework methodology guide
commits.body:
Add comprehensive guide for conducting user discovery sessions covering:
- Core principle of user flows as the spine
- Session 1 structure (People, Flow, Data, Contacts, Why Now)
- Post-session analysis checklist
- Follow-up session templates by stakeholder type
- Language guide for non-technical audiences
- Data complexity signals reference
commits.title: add Discovery Framework methodology guide

commits.subject: docs: enhance CALCULATIONS.md with formula clarifications and missing elements
commits.body:
- Clarify payback period formula context (recurring vs one-time models)
- Reconcile Model 4 variant numbering with use case documentation
- Add buy-in/buy-out/balancing payment calculations for CCA (Model 3)
- Define margin compliance ranges in TP risk section with indicative table
- Fix BOT TP assessment language (remove incorrect "not applicable")
- Add Section 11(e) verification note referencing SARS IN 47
- Add IFRS 15 variable consideration constraint for earnouts
- Clarify One-Time model buyer cost methodology
- Add Mode 1/Mode 2 calculator model mapping table
- Acknowledge economies of scale limitation in assumptions
commits.title: enhance CALCULATIONS.md with formula clarifications and missing elements

commits.subject: docs: enhance Model 6 SaaS use cases with missing elements
commits.body:
Technical corrections:
- Add jurisdictional characterisation caveat (services vs royalties)
- Note implementation cost capitalisation exception to OPEX claim
- Correct 6G regulatory reference (SARB → POPIA/sector regulations)
- Add PE implications note to 6G data residency

New content:
- Add IP ownership guidance section for 6E customisations
- Cross-reference 6I with Model 2F (white-label comparison)
- Add "Standard SaaS Contract Elements" section covering:
  - Service credits and downtime economics
  - Data portability and exit rights
  - Auto-renewal and termination mechanics
  - Data ownership and usage rights

Selection guide restructured:
- Group into pricing variants (6A-6D) and combinable options
- Show example enterprise combination (6B + 6F + 6G + 6H)
- Add common mistakes for data portability, IP ownership, characterisation
commits.title: enhance Model 6 SaaS use cases with missing elements

commits.subject: docs: fix arithmetic and enhance Model 5 use cases
commits.body:
Technical corrections:
- Fix 5B arithmetic: R1.75M annual payments at 8% (was R1.5M with incorrect total)
- Add 5B note on separating interest from principal for TP/withholding
- Add 5C note on supportable discount rate (Buyer credit risk)
- Soften 5E source code premium claim (was "typically 20-50%")
- Add 5G earnout revenue definition guidance with specific example
- Expand 5G TP consideration re: earnout exceeding expectations

New content:
- Add "Sale Mechanics for All Variants" section covering:
  - What transfers (customers, employees, liabilities, data, infrastructure)
  - TP characterisation risk (sale vs licence recharacterisation)
  - IFRS 15 revenue recognition by variant
- Note 5F and 5H combinability with other variants
- Restructure selection guide into payment/relationship/scope categories
- Add common mistakes for transfer mechanics and characterisation risk
commits.title: fix arithmetic and enhance Model 5 use cases

commits.subject: docs: correct BOT model errors in Model 4 use cases
commits.body:
Major structural changes:
- Restructure 4G from standalone variant to Standard Provisions section
- Add operation period economics section (Build/Operate/Transfer phases)
- Add transition and knowledge transfer provisions
- Clarify 4F as staged acquisition extending traditional BOT

Technical corrections:
- Fix 4B: Replace unrealistic 5x GMV multiple with revenue-based formula
- Soften 4C "highest defensibility" to "strong defensibility" with caveats
- Rename 4D to "Cost Recovery with Gain Sharing" and clarify distinction
- Fix 4H: UK does not withhold on standard service fees
- Add 4A long-duration TP risk note
- Add valuation multiple guidance to 4B
- Update selection guide (remove 4G as variant option)
- Expand common mistakes with new entries
commits.title: correct BOT model errors in Model 4 use cases

commits.subject: docs: correct fundamental CCA errors in Model 3 use cases
commits.body:
Major structural changes:
- Rename 3A from "Proportional" to "Equal" (contradiction resolved)
- Rewrite 3C to align contributions with benefits per OECD CCA principles
- Restructure 3G from standalone variant to "Required Provisions" section
- Clarify 3D as mutual development, not a CCA

Technical corrections:
- Remove incorrect "no intercompany profit" claim
- Add buy-in, buy-out, and balancing payment mechanics to overview
- Strengthen 3A TP warning to "presumptively non-arm's length"
- Add periodic review requirement to 3C
- Add commercialisation value methodology to 3E
- Expand 3F JV licensing complexity warning
- Add Pillar Two note to 3H Irish tax rate example
- Update selection guide (remove 3G as variant option)
- Expand common mistakes with new entries
commits.title: correct fundamental CCA errors in Model 3 use cases

- Expand 2E TP complexity discussion with specific challenges
- Add cross-border withholding tax note to overview
- Clarify 2D vs 2C positioning for unpredictable usage
- Add common mistake about 2A perpetual with planned enhancements
- Expand 2H escrow trigger conditions
- Fix 2E attribution methodology terminology
- Add DEMPE analysis note to 2G exclusivity TP consideration

commits.subject: feat: complete pricing calculator with all 5 models + remove legacy code
commits.body:
Pricing Calculator (Mode 1):
- Implemented all 5 pricing models with equilibrium analysis:
  * Subscription (SaaS): Monthly recurring revenue
  * Usage-Based: Pay per unit (API calls, transactions)
  * Per-Seat: Price per user/seat
  * One-Time: Perpetual license + maintenance
  * Marketplace: Commission-based model
- Each model shows equilibrium zone (minimum to maximum viable price)
- Displays suggested price, financial metrics, and ROI for both parties
- Reactive calculations with proper input validation

Legacy Cleanup:
- Deleted entire /legacy/ folder (1.3MB vanilla JS code)
- Updated CLAUDE.md to reflect new TypeScript + SvelteKit architecture
- Removed ~50 legacy files (models, calculators, UI components)

Both modes now complete in new architecture:
- Mode 1: Pricing Calculator (5 models)
- Mode 2: Transaction Structuring (6 models, 47 variants)
commits.title: complete pricing calculator with all 5 models + remove legacy code

commits.subject: feat: implement pricing calculator with subscription model
commits.body:
- Replaced placeholder with working pricing calculator
- Added model selector (5 models: subscription, usage-based, per-seat, one-time, marketplace)
- Implemented subscription model with equilibrium analysis
- Shows minimum price (seller needs), maximum price (buyer willing to pay), and suggested price
- Displays financial metrics, seller position, and client ROI
- Real-time reactive calculations as inputs change
- Subscription model fully functional, other 4 models to be added

The calculator helps find the price range where both seller hits margin AND buyer sees ROI.
commits.title: implement pricing calculator with subscription model

commits.subject: fix: use base path for all navigation links
commits.body:
Import `base` from `$app/paths` and prefix all href attributes and
goto() calls to fix 404 errors on GitHub Pages deployment where the
app is served from /model-pear/ rather than the root.
commits.title: use base path for all navigation links

commits.subject: fix: set NODE_ENV=production in build step
commits.body:
Ensures SvelteKit uses the /model-pear base path for GitHub Pages.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.title: set NODE_ENV=production in build step

commits.subject: fix: set base path for GitHub Pages deployment
commits.body:
Assets were loading from root (/_app/) instead of /model-pear/_app/,
causing 404 errors on the deployed site.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.title: set base path for GitHub Pages deployment

commits.subject: ci: add GitHub Pages deployment workflow
commits.body: Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.title: add GitHub Pages deployment workflow

commits.subject: fix: add root index.html to resolve GitHub Pages 404 error
commits.body:
The monorepo structure moved the vanilla JS app to legacy/ but GitHub
Pages requires index.html at the root. This redirect ensures the site
loads correctly while the SvelteKit build/deploy workflow is set up.

commits.subject: docs: update session notes with Phase 3 completion
feat: add sensitivity analysis module
commits.body:
- Add sensitivity/types.ts with TypeScript interfaces for ranges,
  scenarios, Monte Carlo, and chart data
- Add sensitivity/calculations.ts with:
  - Range creation (createRange, createInputRanges)
  - Scenario generation (best/base/worst case)
  - Input sensitivity analysis (calculateInputSensitivity)
  - Break-even analysis (findBreakEvenValue)
  - Monte Carlo simulation (runMonteCarloSimulation)
  - Statistical utilities (mean, median, percentiles, histogram)
  - Triangular distribution random number generation
  - Formatting utilities (currency, percentage)
- Export all sensitivity functions from main package index
- Add 40 comprehensive tests for sensitivity analysis

Total tests: 301 passing across 8 test files

commits.subject: feat: add projections module with NPV, IRR, payback calculations
commits.body:
- Add projections/types.ts with TypeScript interfaces
- Add projections/calculations.ts with:
  - NPV, present value, future value
  - IRR using Newton-Raphson method
  - MIRR with reinvestment rate
  - Simple and discounted payback period
  - Profitability index
  - ROI and annualized ROI
  - Investment assessment utility
  - Cash flow utilities
- Export projections from main package index
- Add 39 comprehensive tests for projections

Total tests: 261 passing across 7 test files

commits.body:

commits.subject: feat: extract Models 2-6 to TypeScript - Phase 2 complete
commits.body:
Complete extraction of all 6 transaction models (47 variants total):
- Model 2: Licence/Royalties (8 variants)
- Model 3: Joint Development (8 variants)
- Model 4: BOT (8 variants)
- Model 5: Software Sale (8 variants)
- Model 6: SaaS/Subscription (9 variants)

Each model includes:
- Full TypeScript type definitions
- Variant-specific input types
- Developer and Buyer perspective calculations
- Transfer pricing assessment
- Accounting treatment logic

Updated models index with unified exports and model registry.

commits.subject: feat: architecture redesign - Phase 1 foundation
commits.body:
Migrate from vanilla JS to TypeScript + SvelteKit monorepo architecture
for improved maintainability, type safety, and testability.

Changes:
- Add monorepo structure with pnpm workspaces
- Create @model-pear/calculator package with TypeScript
  - Extract Model 1 (Cost-Plus) with full type definitions
  - Add comprehensive test suite (44 tests)
  - Define types for entities, results, and calculations
- Create @model-pear/web SvelteKit app shell
  - Set up Tailwind CSS configuration
  - Add landing page with mode selector
  - Add proof-of-concept UI for Model 1
  - Configure static adapter for GitHub Pages
- Move existing vanilla JS code to legacy/ folder
- Add ARCHITECTURE.md documenting the redesign

Build commands:
- pnpm install: Install dependencies
- pnpm test: Run calculator tests
- pnpm build: Build all packages

This is Phase 1 of 4 in the migration plan.
Next: Extract Models 2-6 and projection calculations.

This completes the documentation gap identified during process review.

commits.subject: docs: add detailed refactor plan for removing Combined perspective
commits.body:
32-session plan to remove all "combined", "group", and "shareholder"
terminology and calculations from the codebase. The tool should be
for two independent entities (Developer + Buyer), not group accounting.

commits.subject: Merge pull request #84 from devmade-ai/claude/add-testing-tab-4ZPHu
commits.body: Add testing lab tab for validating calculation correctness

commits.subject: Refactor testing to workflow-based logical assertions
commits.body:
Replace numerical math tests with readable workflow-based tests that verify
displayed values are logically correct based on user actions and inputs.

Changes:
- Create ASSERTIONS library with reusable logical checks
- Each assertion has: field name, readable logic formula, description
- Define WORKFLOW_SCENARIOS that read like user stories
- Tests now verify "Developer Revenue = Cost × (1 + Markup)" logic
- Not testing math (1000 × 1.1 = 1100), testing business logic
- Update UI to display stories, workflow badges, and assertion formulas

commits.subject: Improve test documentation with business rules and formulas
commits.body:
Each test case now includes:
- businessRule: Explains WHY the test exists (accounting/tax logic)
- formula: Step-by-step calculation showing HOW expected values derive
- source: Reference to documentation (CALCULATIONS.md, IAS 38, OECD, etc.)

The expanded test view in the UI now displays these fields with
appropriate formatting:
- Business Rule: Blue-tinted box explaining the accounting principle
- Formula: Monospace green text showing the calculation steps
- Source: Reference badge linking to standards/documentation

commits.subject: Add testing lab tab for validating calculation correctness
commits.body:
New feature that allows testing pre-populated input combinations against
expected outcomes to verify calculations are working correctly.

Features:
- Testing tab with "Run Tests" button to execute all tests at once
- Individual test execution with detailed pass/fail results
- Pre-defined test cases for Model 1 (all variants), Model 2, Model 3
- Edge case tests (zero cost, high margin, custom tax rates)
- Filter tests by model for focused testing
- Expandable test details showing inputs and expected vs actual values
- Summary panel with pass rate, duration, and error counts
- Custom test capture from current calculator state

commits.subject: Merge pull request #83 from devmade-ai/claude/manual-testing-guide-4CY91
commits.body: Add comprehensive manual testing guide

commits.subject: Align manual testing guide with actual codebase
commits.body:
Updates after verifying against source code:
- Fix header title to "Software Transaction Tool"
- Update mode names: "Inter-Company Tool" and "Pricing Calculator"
- Add correct tab navigation: Calculator, Compliance, Charts, What-If, Projections
- Update default test values (R 1,000,000 dev cost from code defaults)
- Fix Model 1 expected results with accurate calculations
- Update perspective names (developer, buyer, combined)
- Add "What Changed?" feature test case in Compare Mode
- Update Save/Load workflow with actual button names
- Fix Export/Import section with toolbar button names
- Add Clear All test case
- Include model selection modes: Overview, Wizard, Manual

commits.subject: Add comprehensive manual testing guide
commits.body:
Create detailed manual testing documentation covering:
- Quick sanity check (10 min)
- Mode 1: Pricing Calculator (5 models)
- Mode 2: Transaction Structuring (6 models, 47 variants)
- Options Overview and Structure Selector testing
- Model-by-model test cases with expected values
- Perspective toggle and Compare Mode testing
- Sensitivity analysis and Growth projections
- Compliance Analyzer and TP risk testing
- Export/Import functionality
- Edge cases and error handling
- Cross-browser and mobile testing checklist

Includes test data reference values and issue reporting template.

commits.body: Improve UI clarity: standardize terminology and modernize labels

commits.subject: Improve UI clarity: standardize terminology and modernize labels
commits.body:
This commit improves the user experience by standardizing terminology
and making the interface more intuitive for users.

Key changes:
- Unified perspective names: "Your Company", "Client", "Combined View"
- Renamed tabs: "Charts" (was Visualizations), "What-If" (was Sensitivity)
- Changed "Direct" mode to "Manual" and "Explore" to "Select Model"
- Modernized Section 11(e) labels to "Standard Software (2-year write-off)"
  and "Complex Systems (5-year write-off)" with clearer help text
- Updated keyboard shortcut from S to C for Combined View
- Made transfer pricing warning jurisdiction-agnostic
- Updated input categories to "Your Company Costs" and "Client Treatment"
- Updated all documentation to reflect changes

commits.subject: Merge pull request #74 from devmade-ai/claude/continue-implementation-plan-itno5
commits.body: Implement Phase 3.3: Comparison Manager & View Components

commits.subject: Implement Phase 3.3: Comparison Manager & View Components
commits.body:
Add the core UI components for Compare Mode:

- comparison-manager.js: Full panel for managing saved options
  - List, load, delete, rename saved comparisons
  - Edit notes for each comparison
  - Select options for side-by-side comparison
  - Export to JSON/CSV, import from JSON
  - Clear all with confirmation dialog
  - Storage info display

- comparison-view.js: Side-by-side comparison table
  - Compare 2-4 options simultaneously
  - Developer, Buyer, Combined metrics sections
  - Transfer pricing risk display
  - Difference column with directional arrows
  - Best/worst value highlighting
  - Export comparison as JSON/CSV

- calculator.js: Integration updates
  - Import and initialize comparison components
  - Wire up "View Saved" and "Compare" buttons
  - Add cleanup for comparison modules

This substantially completes Phase 3 (Compare Mode) of the
implementation plan.

commits.subject: Merge pull request #73 from devmade-ai/claude/continue-implementation-plan-OB1Hj
commits.body: Implement Phase 3 Compare Mode - State & Storage Foundation

commits.subject: Implement Phase 3 Compare Mode - State & Storage Foundation
commits.body:
Add core infrastructure for the Compare Mode feature:

- Create utils/storage.js with localStorage persistence for saved comparisons
  - Version-tracked storage format with 20 comparison limit
  - Export (JSON/CSV) and import functionality
  - Comparison summary generation for side-by-side view

- Extend state/app-state.js with comparison management
  - savedComparisons array in state
  - Action creators: save, load, delete, update, clear comparisons
  - UI state for comparison view and modal

- Add Save as Option UI in calculator.js
  - Save Actions Bar with Save/View/Compare buttons
  - Save Modal with name and notes input
  - Auto-generated default names from model/variant
  - Reactive UI updates on comparison changes

This completes Sub-phases 3.1 (State & Storage) and 3.2 (Save UI).
Next: comparison-manager.js and comparison-view.js components.

commits.subject: Merge pull request #72 from devmade-ai/claude/continue-implementation-plan-SsD6F
commits.body: Implement Phase 2: Options Overview - Core Foundation

commits.subject: Complete Phase 2: Add localStorage persistence for view mode
commits.body:
Add user preference persistence so the selected model selection mode
(Overview/Wizard/Direct) is remembered across sessions.

Changes:
- Add loadSelectionModePreference() to load from localStorage
- Add saveSelectionModePreference() to persist preference
- Initialize selectionMode from localStorage (defaults to 'overview')
- Save preference when mode changes via toggle buttons or navigation

localStorage key: 'model-pear-selection-mode'
Valid values: overview, wizard, direct

Phase 2 (Options Overview) is now complete.

commits.subject: Implement Phase 2: Options Overview - Core Foundation
commits.body:
Add new Options Overview landing view that shows all 6 transaction models
at a glance, addressing the gap where users had to pick a model before
seeing alternatives.

New features:
- Model cards grid with icon, summary, key features, best-for tags
- Quick comparison table for side-by-side model analysis
- "Explore" buttons to dive into specific models
- "Use the guided wizard" link for recommendation-based selection
- Three-way toggle: Overview / Wizard / Direct selection modes
- Overview is now the default landing view

Technical changes:
- Enhanced getModelMetadata() with rich overview data
- Added getModelComparisonData() for comparison table
- New options-overview.js component with responsive CSS grid
- Updated calculator.js with Overview mode integration

commits.subject: Merge pull request #71 from devmade-ai/claude/start-implementation-plan-vcGt2
commits.body: Implement Phase 1: Perspective Toggle Enhancement

commits.subject: Implement Phase 1: Perspective Toggle Enhancement
commits.body:
This commit implements Phase 1 of the IMPLEMENTATION_PLAN, enhancing
the perspective toggle and party relationship selection experience.

New Features:
- Party Relationship Selector (party-selector.js): Prominent radio cards
  for selecting between "Independent Parties" (2 perspectives) and
  "Related Parties" (3 perspectives with Shareholder view)
- Enhanced Perspective Toggle: Dynamic labels that change based on
  relationship type - "Net Effect" becomes "Shareholder" when Related
- Keyboard shortcuts: D (Developer), B (Buyer), S (Shareholder/Net Effect),
  M (toggle Mutual Ownership)

Changes:
- Created ui/intercompany/party-selector.js
- Added setRelationshipType() and arePartiesRelated() to app-state.js
- Integrated party selector into calculator.js
- Removed "Relationship Settings" from entity-config.js (moved to party selector)
- Enhanced perspective-toggle.js with dynamic display and keyboard shortcuts
- Updated IMPLEMENTATION_PLAN.md with completed tasks and session notes
- Updated UI_UX_GUIDE.md with new keyboard shortcuts and changelog

Phase 1 Status: COMPLETE
Next: Phase 2 (Options Overview) or user testing

commits.subject: Fix reserved keyword 'eval' in destructuring assignment
commits.body:
The compliance-analyzer.js was using 'eval' as a variable name in a
destructuring assignment, which is a reserved JavaScript keyword and
causes a SyntaxError. Renamed to 'evaluation'.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.title: Fix reserved keyword 'eval' in destructuring assignment

commits.subject: Merge pull request #58 from devmade-ai/claude/add-error-checking-KFddQ
commits.body: Add error handling and quality improvements
commits.title: Merge pull request #58 from devmade-ai/claude/add-error-checking-KFddQ

commits.subject: Add error handling and quality improvements
commits.body:
- Add global error handlers (window.onerror, onunhandledrejection) in app.js
- Wrap app initialization in try-catch with user-friendly error display
- Add safeGetElement() and safeRenderChart() helpers in charts/index.js
- Refactor all 18 chart rendering calls to use null-safe helpers
- Add defensive null/NaN checks to formatCurrency, formatPercentage, formatNumber
- Update HISTORY.md with quality improvements documentation
commits.title: Add error handling and quality improvements

commits.subject: Implement Phase 13: Polish & Documentation
commits.body:
Complete the final phase of the roadmap with comprehensive documentation updates:

- Update BUSINESS_GUIDE.md with all 6 inter-company models, 3 modules,
  sensitivity analysis, growth projections, and comprehensive glossary
- Update CLAUDE.md with new architecture (~35 modules, ~12,000 lines),
  three-perspective framework, and development guidelines
- Update CALCULATIONS.md with inter-company transaction formulas for all
  models, transfer pricing risk calculations, sensitivity analysis, and
  growth projection calculations (NPV, IRR, payback)
- Update IMPLEMENTATION_ROADMAP.md to mark Phase 13 as complete

All 13 phases of the implementation roadmap are now complete.
commits.title: Implement Phase 13: Polish & Documentation

commits.subject: Merge pull request #56 from devmade-ai/claude/next-roadmap-phase-48OOC
commits.body: Implement Phase 12: Growth Projections
commits.title: Merge pull request #56 from devmade-ai/claude/next-roadmap-phase-48OOC

commits.subject: Implement Phase 12: Growth Projections
commits.body:
Add multi-year financial projections with:
- NPV calculations per party (Developer, Buyer, Combined)
- IRR calculations using Newton-Raphson method
- Payback period calculations (simple and discounted)
- Asset value trajectories with enhancements
- Revenue break-even analysis
- Projection visualizations: cash flow charts, ROI trajectory,
  asset value charts, and investment assessment dashboards
- Configurable parameters: projection period, discount rate,
  revenue growth, inflation, and enhancement costs
- New "Projections" tab in the inter-company calculator
commits.title: Implement Phase 12: Growth Projections

commits.subject: Merge pull request #55 from devmade-ai/claude/next-roadmap-phase-mWzSZ
commits.body: Implement Phase 11: Range Selections & Sensitivity Analysis
commits.title: Merge pull request #55 from devmade-ai/claude/next-roadmap-phase-mWzSZ

commits.subject: Implement Phase 11: Range Selections & Sensitivity Analysis
commits.body:
Adds comprehensive sensitivity analysis capabilities:

- Range Input Framework (11.1):
  - Low/Base/High input mode with color-coded fields
  - Slider-based variance adjustment
  - Variance patterns (conservative/moderate/aggressive)
  - Support for cost, revenue, margin, duration inputs

- Sensitivity Calculations (11.2):
  - Best/Base/Worst case scenario calculations
  - Break-even analysis with margin of safety
  - Input sensitivity ranking by impact
  - Monte Carlo simulation with triangular distribution

- Sensitivity Visualizations (11.3):
  - Tornado chart showing input sensitivities
  - Fan chart for projection ranges
  - Break-even margin visualization
  - Monte Carlo histogram with percentiles

New files:
- models/intercompany/sensitivity-analysis.js
- ui/intercompany/range-input.js
- ui/intercompany/sensitivity-visualizations.js

Integrates into calculator UI with new Sensitivity tab.
commits.title: Implement Phase 11: Range Selections & Sensitivity Analysis

commits.subject: Merge pull request #54 from devmade-ai/claude/next-roadmap-phase-u11Ud
commits.body: Implement Phase 10: Advanced Visualizations Module
commits.title: Merge pull request #54 from devmade-ai/claude/next-roadmap-phase-u11Ud

commits.subject: Implement Phase 10: Advanced Visualizations Module
commits.body:
Add comprehensive visualization capabilities for inter-company transaction analysis:

10.1 Cross-Model Comparison Charts:
- Model comparison summary table with side-by-side metrics
- Combined asset position by model (stacked bar chart)
- Total cost to buyer ranked comparison
- Developer return comparison across all 6 models
- Risk score comparison radar chart

10.2 Timeline Visualizations:
- Asset value over time with amortisation trajectories
- Cash flow waterfall showing transaction components
- Multi-entity amortisation schedule (accounting vs S11e tax)
- Project phase Gantt chart for development timeline

10.3 Risk Visualizations:
- Transfer pricing risk heat map by factor
- Risk vs return quadrant chart (scatter plot)
- Compliance score gauge (radial bar)
- Sensitivity tornado chart (Stage 2 preparation)

Integration:
- Added tabbed interface (Calculator, Compliance, Visualizations)
- Integrated with existing ApexCharts library
- Full dark theme support
- Dynamic data generation from calculation results
commits.title: Implement Phase 10: Advanced Visualizations Module

commits.subject: Merge pull request #53 from devmade-ai/claude/next-phase-roadmap-fdcXa
commits.body: Implement Phase 9: Compliance Analyzer Module
commits.title: Merge pull request #53 from devmade-ai/claude/next-phase-roadmap-fdcXa

commits.subject: Implement Phase 9: Compliance Analyzer Module
commits.body:
Add comprehensive compliance analysis for inter-company software transactions:

- Transfer pricing risk scoring with weighted factors (margin compliance,
  documentation, substance, comparability, consistency)
- Accounting treatment summaries for Developer and Buyer perspectives
- Tax impact analysis with Section 11(e) schedules, CGT calculations,
  timing differences, and deferred tax
- Six compliance checklists (written agreements, TP documentation,
  development phase, cost tracking, control assessment, related party)
- Interactive UI with risk dashboard, heat map visualization,
  tab-based navigation, and PDF export capability
commits.title: Implement Phase 9: Compliance Analyzer Module

commits.subject: Merge pull request #52 from devmade-ai/claude/next-phase-roadmap-dQ5hB
commits.body: Implement Phase 8: Structure Selector Module
commits.title: Merge pull request #52 from devmade-ai/claude/next-phase-roadmap-dQ5hB

commits.subject: Implement Phase 8: Structure Selector Module
commits.body:
Add intelligent decision tree wizard for guided model selection:

- Decision tree logic with 7 factor questions (IP ownership, cash flow,
  risk allocation, asset recognition, consolidation, software maturity,
  control preference)
- Scoring engine that calculates and normalizes model recommendations
- Step-by-step wizard UI with progress indicator
- Live preview of top recommendations while answering questions
- Variant recommendation logic for each model
- Rationale generation explaining why models are recommended
- Mode toggle between Wizard and Direct selection
- Integration with existing calculator UI
commits.title: Implement Phase 8: Structure Selector Module
